abstracts.cdata!:
The Debt and Debt Service Reduction Loan
            Project (DDSR) will reimburse Poland for a portion of the
            implementation cost of the Debt and Debt Service Reduction
            Program. The program is in the form of a) release of the
            Set-Asides from three existing adjustment operations; b) a
            stand-alone debt and debt service reduction loan; and c) a
            partial waiver of the negative pledge clauses in the loan
            and guarantee agreements. This will eliminate a source of
            business uncertainty, and will contribute to increasing its
            productive potential and its medium- and long-term rate of
            growth. The main concern is presented by the greater
            inflexibility of the resulting debt structure after the
            execution of the DDSR, which could endanger repayments if
            the economic condition deteriorated. This risk would be
            compounded by slippage on the economic policy front.
